705461f.text:
Lincoln Place (right) at the N.E. corner of Eighth Avenue, showing in a set of two views the Montauk Club. See History of Architectual and Bldg. Trades, Vol I., of N.Y., 1899. F. H. Kimball was the architect. It is a copy of the Ca. D' Oro located on the Grand Canal in Venice Italy. Under the figures in View No. 2 is this inscription "1650- Wyandance - Suchane - Panannack, his wife and his son Wiankabone gave a deed to Lion Gardiner of Sagbrook, east Hapton, Long Island: July 13, 1650."
About 1901
Views 1 and 2
Harper & Bros.

View 1 - Neg # 1367
View 2 -

705462f-a.text:
Lincoln Place, at the N.E. corner of Eighth Ave. This is a view of the Montauk Club, No. 32 Eighth Ave.
August 2, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
